ftp.name: Anonymous FTP Access
ftp.recommendation: Disable anonymous FTP access if not required

ftp.name: Weak FTP Authentication
ftp.description: FTP server may have weak or default credentials
ftp.recommendation: Implement strong authentication and disable weak credentials

ssh.name: Weak SSH Algorithms
ssh.description: SSH server supports weak encryption algorithms
ssh.recommendation: Upgrade to SSH version 2 and disable weak algorithms

ssh.name: SSH Version 1 Enabled
ssh.description: SSH version 1 is enabled and contains security vulnerabilities
ssh.recommendation: Disable SSH version 1 and use only version 2

http.name: Unencrypted HTTP Traffic
http.description: Web server serves content over unencrypted HTTP
http.recommendation: Implement HTTPS and redirect HTTP traffic

http.name: Missing Security Headers
http.description: Web server may be missing important security headers
http.recommendation: Implement security headers like HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options

https.name: Weak SSL/TLS Configuration
https.description: HTTPS server may support weak SSL/TLS versions or ciphers
https.recommendation: Configure strong SSL/TLS settings and disable weak protocols

smb.name: EternalBlue Vulnerability
smb.description: SMB server may be vulnerable to EternalBlue exploit

rdp.name: BlueKeep Vulnerability
rdp.description: RDP server may be vulnerable to BlueKeep exploit
